subject: Cybersecurity
title: Spoofing Biometrics: Fooling the Sensors
description: One-minute skill: Spoofing Biometrics: Fooling the Sensors.

hook.text: Samsung's Galaxy S10 facial recognition was fooled by a photograph. A $1,000 phone defeated by a printed picture.

buildup.text: Biometric spoofing uses replicas: silicone fingerprints, 3D-printed masks, high-res iris photos, or recorded.

discovery.text: Liveness detection counters spoofing by checking for pulse, eye movement, skin texture, or asking for random actions.

twist.text: Researchers fooled Apple's Face ID with a $150 3D-printed mask in 2017. The arms race between spoofers and.

climax.text: Biometrics are not passwords â€” they're probabilities. A system decides if you're 'close enough' to the stored template.

punchline.text: Your face is a probability score, not a perfect match.

quiz.question: How do modern biometric systems counter spoofing?
options: Liveness detection checks for pulse, eye movement, and skin texture
